Configure Product Info and Options on the Product Detail Page

Precisely adjust which information and options are prominently available when a buyer visits the Product Detail page. Select which content is most meaningful for your buyers: short description, SKU, Add to Cart button, and so on. Show that content at the top of the page and help buyers make quick purchase decisions.

REQUIRED EDITIONS AND USER PERMISSIONS

Salesforce Compatibility

Salesforce Classic (not available in all orgs) and Lightning Experience for Enterprise, Performance, Unlimited, and Developer editions.




B2B Commerce Compatibility

B2B Commerce for Visualforce Winter ’21 (version 4.13)
B2B Commerce for Visualforce Spring ’20 (version 4.12)
B2B Commerce for Visualforce Summer ’19 (version 4.11)
B2B Commerce for Visualforce Spring ’19 (version 4.10)
B2B Commerce for Visualforce Summer ’18 (version 4.9)


USER PERMISSIONS NEEDED
To access CC Admin and change settings:	Access B2B Commerce for Visualforce Admin Settings permission set

You can configure the following details and options:

The product's SKU (1).
The product's unit of measure (2).
The product's available inventory, or a generic availability message, if specified (3).
The product's short description (4).
The product's price information (5). You can optionally show the list price (6) and the buyer's savings (7) based on their specific entitled price. List price depends on the product's price in the storefront's base price list.
Controls for adding a specific quantity of the product to a wish list (if enabled) or cart (8). If you've defined any product quantity rules, quantity increment controls are available. You can also specify what happens when the buyer clicks Add to Cart: either stay on the current page, or immediately navigate to the Shopping Cart page.
NOTE Other information and options become available depending on the type of product shown. For example, the Product Detail page for an aggregated product includes a picklist where a buyer can select a particular style. For more information about specific product types, see Types of Products for B2B Commerce for Visualforce.

To configure the Product Detail page information and options, update your storefront configuration settings.

On the CC Admin tab in your org, select your storefront (1).
In the Storefront Settings menu, select Configuration Settings (2).
From the Module picklist, select Product Detail (3).
Specify what product information you want to show.
Find the following configurations, and find their values:
Show SKU (4, 5)
Show Unit of Measure (6, 7)
Show Availability (8, 9)
Show Short Description (10, 11)
Show Pricing (12, 13)
If a product detail you want to include is TRUE, skip this step.
If the detail you want to include is FALSE or doesn't exist, continue to the next step.
Click New , enter the following values in the New Page Setting window, and click Create.
FIELD	VALUE
Module	Product Detail
Configuration	
Show SKU
Show Unit of Measure
Show Availability
Show Short Description
Show Pricing

Page	PDP
Value	TRUE
If you enabled Show Pricing, specify which pricing information you want to include.
Find the following configurations, and find their values:
Show List Price (14, 15)
Show Savings (16, 17)
If the pricing information you want to include is TRUE, skip this step.
If the pricing information you want to include is FALSE or doesn't exist, continue to the next step.
Click New , enter the following values in the New Page Setting window, and click Create.
FIELD	VALUE
Module	Product Detail
Configuration	
Show List Price
Show Savings

Page	PDP
Value	TRUE
Specify the behavior you want for the Add to Cart button.
Find the following configurations, and find their values:
Show Add To Cart (18, 19)
Show the quantity field, Add to Wish List button, and Add to Cart button.
Go To Cart (20, 21)
Navigate to the Shopping Cart page immediately after the Add to Cart button is clicked. When this configuration is FALSE, the buyer remains on the Product Detail page after clicking the Add to Cart button.
If the Add to Cart behavior you want to include is TRUE, skip this step.
If you want to change the current Add to Cart behavior, or if the appropriate configuration doesn't exist, continue to the next step.
Click New , enter the following values in the New Page Setting window, and click Create.
FIELD	VALUE
Module	Product Detail
Configuration	
Show Add To Cart
Go To Cart

Page	PDP
Value	TRUE or FALSE
Build and activate a new configuration cache.
